Ingredients.3: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)

Ingredients.7: 1 pinch garlic powder, or to taste

Ingredients.8: 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.9: 1 pinch seasoned salt, or to taste

Ingredients.14: 1 clove garlic, minced, or to taste

Ingredients.15: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained

Ingredients.17: 1 cup fresh spinach, or to taste

Ingredients.18: 1 cup chopped romaine lettuce, or to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet.

Directions.2: Bring water and brown rice to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in diced tomatoes with chile peppers. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 50 minutes.

Directions.3: While rice is cooking, mix cumin, turmeric, basil, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and seasoned salt together in a large bowl. Add olive oil. Toss potatoes in the mixture until well coated. Lay potatoes in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.

Directions.4: Bake in the preheated oven until fork-tender, 15 to 30 minutes, depending on the size of the cubes, checking halfway through cooking time and flipping over as needed.

Directions.5: While potatoes are cooking, heat a skillet over medium heat. Saute bell pepper and onion in the hot pan until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and set aside.

Directions.6: Heat black beans in a saucepan over medium-low heat until hot, 2 to 3 minutes. Keep warm.

Directions.7: Meanwhile, heat tortillas in a separate skillet over low heat until warm, 1 to 2 minutes, or according to package instructions.

Directions.8: Lay out tortillas and fill as desired with cooked rice, beans, potatoes, pepper-onion mixture, spinach, romaine lettuce, and salsa as desired. Wrap up into burritos and serve.
